Posts.Content: GiseleB wrote: Hi I know that Myriad has a patent on BRCA1/2 testing but what if there was a lab outside of North America that provides the same service but only at a fraction of the cost.  What are your opinions?  I found a lab but I was not sure. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: BRCA1 and BRCA2 testing from a lab other than Myriad GiseleB exbrnxgrl

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2013 11:27AM GiseleB wrote: Hi you made some very good points. The method is not proprietary but yes I know that credibility is a concern.  I guess there is no way around Myriad?  besides the patent will end soon and I am sure other labs may want to jump on and provide a very similar service.
Posts.Title: BRCA1 and BRCA2 testing from a lab other than Myriad GiseleB exbrnxgrl

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2013 10:41AM GiseleB wrote: I agree if it was some sketchy lab but what if it was credible.  Plus I heard this test is very simple to do but other labs just cant do it because of the patent. How important is the genetic councellor and physician when someone wants to determine the BRCA mutations? Thanks
